verses.text: Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence \add am\add* base among you, but being absent am bold toward you:

but I beseech \add you\add*, that I may not be bold when I am present with \add that\add* confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against some, which think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:
(for the weapons of our warfare \add are\add* not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds;)
casting down imaginations, and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of Christ;
and having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.

Do ye look on \add things\add* after the outward appearance? If any \add man\add* trust to himself that \add he\add* is Christ’s, let him of himself think this again, that, as he \add is\add* Christ’s, even so \add are\add* we Christ’s.
For though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction, I should not be ashamed:
that I may not seem as if \add I\add* would terrify you by letters.
For \add his\add* letters, say they, \add are\add* weighty and powerful; but \add his\add* bodily presence \add is\add* weak, and \add his\add* speech contemptible.
Let such a one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such \add will we be\add* also in deed when we are present.

For we dare not make \add ourselves\add* of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves amongst themselves, are not wise.
But we will not boast of \add things\add* without \add our\add* measure, but according to the measure of the rule which God hath distributed to us, a measure to reach even unto you.
For we stretch not ourselves beyond \add our measure\add*, as though we reached not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in \add preaching\add* the gospel of Christ:

not boasting of \add things\add* without \add our\add* measure, \add that is\add*, of other \add men’s\add* labours; but having hope, when your faith is increased, that \add we\add* shall be enlarged by you according to our rule abundantly,
to preach the gospel in the \add regions\add* beyond you, \add and\add* not to boast in another \add man’s\add* line of \add things\add* made ready to our hand.
But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.
For not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.
